intro: Chamaeiris anguifuga, commonly known as the snake-root or viper's root, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that has been traditionally used in folk medicine. Its leaves are opposite and often have a waxy coating, while its roots are long and tubular, giving it its common name. Chamaeiris anguifuga is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments.
